alert.note: Alert for Knox; Sullivan (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 30 at 10:24PM EDT until April 07 at 6:17AM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Indiana...Illinois... Wabash River at Mount Carmel, Terre Haute, Riverton, Hutsonville Legacy Power Plant Site, and Montezuma. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana... White River at Petersburg and Hazleton .Lowland flooding from excessive rainfall remains on portions of the Wabash River from Montezuma downstream, and on the White River at Petersburg and Hazleton. Flooding on the Wabash River is expected to be prolonged by Wednesday`s rainfall, extending the end time to Monday afternoon. At points upstream from Riverton, recent rains will cause a rise back into minor flood stage. Flooding on the White River is not expected to impacted to the degree the Wabash will be by the recent precipitation, keeping the end date on Thursday. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THURSDAY, APRIL 07... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wabash River at Riverton. * WHEN...Until Thursday, April 07. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Extensive lowland flooding is in progress. High water surrounds many river cabins. Access to most river cabins is by boat only. Levees begin to protect farmland. Extensive flooding of Leaverton Park occurs in Palestine, Illinois. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 PM CDT Wednesday /10:00 PM EDT Wednesday/ the stage was 17.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:00 PM CDT Wednesday /10:00 PM EDT Wednesday/ was 18.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 18.2 feet early Sunday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage Wednesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. This statement will be updated within the next 12 to 24 hours.
